intro: Conium sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian hemlock, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
